cause_of_action: Dispute over leadership succession due to conflicting elections and customs.
procedural_fairness: Judicial review of election processes, analysis of band customs, and consideration of administrative law principles.
administrative_decision: Two groups claimed legitimacy as Chief and Council.
relevant_rule: Administrative law principles, band custom, and electoral procedures govern the selection of leadership in Indigenous bands not subject to the Indian Act.
decision_reasoning: Council No. 2 was elected without following proper procedures, including seeking a writ of quo warranto.
application_details: A new Custom Leadership Selection Code was adopted by referendum, legitimizing Council No. 1's successor.
result_of_case: Court dismissed the motion, confirming Council No. 1's legitimacy and upholding the new Custom Leadership Selection Code.
